intro: Cryptantha nubigena var. macounii, commonly known as the Macoun's cryptantha, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate blue to purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils in open habitats such as meadows and slopes. It has a compact growth habit with small, hairy leaves and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and endemic species.
